conditions.today: 6AM - Good Monday morning, Jackson Hole! Today's mountain conditions will look a lot like yesterday's. Expect chalky, fast groomers during the morning hours, with some cold-preserved pockets of powder awaiting harvest on north aspects. Ample sunshine will accompany Westerlys that'll hold steady around 10mph with gusts upÂ  to 34 mph possible. This morning's inversion will break eventually and give way to a high of 35 at the base and 27 up high. Enjoy! -OH
conditions.yesterday: Keep your weekend momentum in forward motion with bluebird skies and a slight morning temperature inversion. Look for clear and sunny skies throughout the day with light to moderate winds trending out of the West. Temperatures will reach the low 20's across the high elevations while the valley floor will climb into the low to mid-30's by late afternoon. Cold overnight temps have preserved our deepening base keeping ski conditions chalky and fast. Finish off your Sunday with some leftovers lurking in the trees or just enjoy some cruisers in the sunshine. It will be a beautiful day in the Tetons! -MB

trends: Great week for snow - 28" in last 7 days
recommendations: Fresh corduroy on Hanna (Upper) - perfect for intermediate skiers
Fresh corduroy on Ranger - challenging for advanced skiers
Fresh corduroy on Gros Ventre (Upper) - perfect for intermediate skiers

morningBrief.headline: Base Conditions Solid
morningBrief.body: The snow from earlier this week is aging gracefully. Still soft, still fun.
